entries.title: Casey Rubber Stamps
entries.imageAlt: Image of rubber stamps, arranged in rows on a shop display.
entries.description: A bit of a niche shop, where you can give them an image of any stamp you want, and have them make it for you! I feel like it'd be really cute to make a stamp for your personal artwork and just stamp paper, ceramics, etc. everytime you finish something and have it act as your signature.

entries.title: Gold Star Fragrances
entries.imageAlt: Image of the exterior window of Gold Star Fragrances.
entries.description: Found this recommendation through an Instagram reel. Would be good to find some perfumes or scents you like and ask if they have any dupes for it!

entries.title: Craftsman Ave
entries.imageAlt: Image of a copper lamp, made through a Craftsman Ave workshop.
entries.description: Hosts workshops on knife making, woodworking, welding, leather-working, and stained glass. Each workshop takes about 4 hours, and is beginner-friendly! They have date night packages that seem intimate and fun!

entries.title: High Valley Books
entries.imageAlt: Image of a graphic representing the design of digital records.
entries.description: Really unique space - it's the kind you see on social media and think, wow that's so New York. I spent 1.5 hours here browsing, but didn't end up buying anything... I feel like if you're into fashion and photography, it's great; I was looking for graphic design and the pickings were slim.

entries.title: Temple Court Ballroom
entries.imageAlt: Image of a bar with extravagant furnishings.
entries.description: I first discovered this place from an Instagram reel where this guy said he's been trying to take his girlfriend to places that are more her vibe (good ambiance, lively but not too lively). So maybe this is a good date spot? There's jazz brunch every week and apparently the food is amazing.

entries.title: Powerhouse Arts Center
entries.imageAlt: Image of a red brick building, previously the abandoned Brooklyn Rapid Transit Powerhouse on the Gowanus Canal.
entries.description: An arts centre that hosts artist shops, classes and workshops, and events. It's located right by the Gowanus Canal - an area with a complicated history, including ongoing environmental cleanup efforts due to past industrial pollution. I'd love to visit as a day trip to explore the creative community there and learn more about the canal's transformation!

entries.title: Cellar Dog
entries.imageAlt: Image of pool tables in dim lighting.
entries.description: Jazz, games (billiards, ping pong, & shuffleboard), and drinks! Would be a fun date night or to go with a big group of people.

entries.title: Jewelry Workshop with Carolina Iwanow
entries.imageAlt: Image of different silver jewelry made in Carolina Iwanow's workshop.
entries.description: If you bring 2 other friends with you, you can attend a single-day workshop that's $420 per person. Sounds pricey but at least it includes all the materials (silver, flat back gemstone), and the tools/lesson needed to craft it!

entries.title: Evento Cooking Class
entries.imageAlt: Image of someone making pasta from scratch using dough.
entries.description: First you make pasta/pizza/whatever, then you have a party. They have private events that you can book with 10 people (probably good for a birthday party) but they also have ticketed events around $100-200 per person.

entries.title: BrownstoneJazz Bedstuy
entries.description: Live jazz in a restored 19th-century Victorian brownstone. The neighbourhood of Bedford-Stuyvesant is also quite known for jazz! There's a Southern fish-fry buffet and open mic sessions as a bonus. Prices here vary, but looks to be around $50 per person.

entries.title: Caffe Reggio
entries.imageAlt: Image of Caffe Reggio at night, with warm lighting on interiors painted green.
entries.description: Apparently the first cafe in the US to serve a Cappuccino. Probably won't even be able to drink it with real milk since I'm lactose-intolerant, but I want to be a tourist and go somewhere historical.

entries.title: Timeout Market Dumbo
entries.imageAlt: Image of a bridge in New York in the background and people in the foreground, taken from the Time Out Market terrace.
entries.description: Relax by the waterfront! There's food, drink, and cultural events. If you go to the terrace, you can see the Brooklyn and Manhattan Bridges. I think it'd be a fun date, especially if there's something special going on!

entries.title: Urban Glass Workshop
entries.description: I would love to make a sparkly bead to add to my bracelets or make an earring from it. It seems like such a fun activity to do with friends, especially if you each make something and then swap beads as a little keepsake. This class in particular is $145.

entries.title: Nusprodukte Lamp Workshop
entries.description: The lamps you can make here are a bit unorthodox! The class is $100-200, including all the materials needed.

entries.title: Brooklyn Glass Ring Workshop
entries.description: A 3-hour glass ring class where you can expect to make around 3 rings! You'll need to book in advance, and the class is around $215. It sounds like such a fun date idea - you can make one for yourself, and exchange the other ones with your friend(s) or partner. I loveee symbolic items like this!

entries.title: SRC Risograph Workshop
entries.imageAlt: Image of a Pokemon Risograph workshop ad.
entries.description: This collaborative artist-run space and creative studio has independent publishing, art book production, and more! They usually have risograph classes a few times a month and we'd have to look at the website to see what kind of workshops are happening. They had a Pikachu riso print workshop awhile ago that I thought was quite cute. Classes range from around $60-$300 depending on the subject.

entries.title: Maybe Happy Ending Broadway Show
entries.imageAlt: Image of Maybe Happy Ending cast.
entries.description: Basically adding here so I can remember to watch with my boyfriend. He really wanted to watch this one, and I love Broadway! Tickets are usually around a hundred-or-so. If you go to the box office the day of, you can ask for rush tickets but no guarantee the show has any tickets left!

entries.title: Lucky Risograph Workshop
entries.imageAlt: Image of a risograph print with a crab holding a heart saying 'xie xie'.
entries.description: This is a risograph printing press that works with local and international creators to reinterpret risograph with art books, zines, and projects. I LOVE the colours they have here. I feel like their workshops don't happen often so we should try to catch one ASAP if we can! One class is around $200.
